channel.title: Economics on TechnoStreet
channel.description: Recent content in Economics on TechnoStreet

item.title: Twitter ‘sued by staff’ as layoffs begin; Sizewell new nuclear plant under review – business live
item.description: Twitter ‘sued by staff’ as layoffs begin; Sizewell new nuclear plant under review – business live Rolling coverage of the latest economic and financial newsElon Musk announces Twitter mass layoffs to begin FridayThe Sizewell C nuclear power plant in Suffolk is reportedly under review as the Government looks to cut spending to fill the UK’s fiscal ‘black hole’.

item.title: Inflation in UK shops hits record high as food prices soar – business live
item.description: Inflation in UK shops hits record high as food prices soar – business live Rolling coverage of the latest economic and financial news, as food prices rise at fastest rate since at least 2005 Government tests energy blackout emergency plans as supply fears growSupermarkets need to offer good value this Christmas to win business from cash-strapped customers, adds Mike Watkins, Head of Retailer and Business Insight at NielsenIQ.

item.description: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell Faces Political Pressure Over Interest Rate Hikes U.

item.title: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen: US Financial Stability Risks Could Materialize, Cites ‘Dangerous and Volatile Environment’
item.description: Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen: US Financial Stability Risks Could Materialize, Cites ‘Dangerous and Volatile Environment’ Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen has warned that financial stability risks could materialize in the U.

item.title: Report: Billionaire Says Britain May Be Forced to Seek Bailout From IMF if It Does Not Renegotiate Brexit Deal
item.description: Report: Billionaire Says Britain May Be Forced to Seek Bailout From IMF if It Does Not Renegotiate Brexit Deal British billionaire investor Guy Hands has reckoned that Britain will become “the sick man of Europe” and may be forced to seek a bailout from the International Monetary Fund (IMF) if it does not renegotiate its Brexit deal.

item.title: JPMorgan Chase President: Fed Isn’t Too Hawkish and Crypto Is ‘Kind of Irrelevant’
item.description: JPMorgan Chase President: Fed Isn’t Too Hawkish and Crypto Is ‘Kind of Irrelevant’ JPMorgan Chase’s president that crypto “is kind of irrelevant in the scheme of things.
